page.title: 11MARKET RASEN RACE COURSE
page.content: During the first half of the 19th. century the Brocklesby,Burton and S.Wold Hunts held Point to Point races on various sites in the area. Racing continued in this form until 1924, when the present course was constructed just to the east of the town alongside the Louth road. The site was used by the army during the 2nd. world war and in 1946 there was a crowd of over 22,000 to enjoy the re- opening of this very picturesque course. Further improvements , including a fine grandstand built in 1967, have been added and large crowds regularly attend the N.H. meetings held through the season(about 15 per year). It is the only race-course in Lincs. and is possibly has the finest setting in the country. The grandstand and facilities are also used for parties,gatherings, etc.
